content.description: Somewhat difficult start on a left hand pinch.  Move straight up the wall to a bulge.  Pulling the bulge is probably the hardest part.  Super easy moves after that to the chains.
content.location: The route right of Gut Punch the Buddha.

content.description: Cruxy start. Locate mini tufa pinch and crank up...head straight into the tall grass on ledge, then traverse left and join up with Gut Punch the Buddha.
content.location: Starts right of Gut Punch right in front of the tree.

content.description: The lower section with reachy crux moves is slightly over-hanging and ends at a ledge maybe 18 feet up, after which the climbing is easier up to the anchor.  Surmounting the ledge can be awkward. Taller climbers might find this easier than 11a.
content.location: Left of Gut Punch The Buddha.

content.description: sixth route from left (last route on right). Face climb, pockety, and the limestone is sharp (feet stick like glue). A little more technical than the other 5.9s in the area
content.location: first route on right of wall

content.description:
Fun face climb with reachy moves. Start can be hard for some. 

  Bolted well, but it felt a bit harder than 5.9 to me.
content.location:
Route is on the Oblivion (or Shortcake) Wall. 

  There is a tree to the climbers right at the base of the start and a few trees about 3/4 way up.

content.description: Thin opening moves lead to an easier finish on large blocks and jugs above.
content.location: Located on the far left side of Oblivion Wall.

content.description: Very similar to Got a Dollar?, only a little longer.  Challenging moves on the lower part of the route lead to huge jugs at the top.
content.location: One route to the right of Got a Dollar? on the left side of Oblivion Wall.

content.description: Start on the now broken mini-tufa of "Pinch the Buddha".  (You can also use the tree to get up to the featured band but probably makes the route 5.10b).  At about 10 feet off the ground, follow the features and transverse to the left and join "Gut Punch the Buddha" between the 1st and 2nd bolts.  The crux is joining Pinch the Buddha.  At the ledge, use either a static move or a mini-dyno from the right.  After obtaining the ledge, follow and finish on "Gut Punch the Buddha."
content.protection: TR or you can use the 3 bolts of Pinch the Buddha.  Anchors at the top.
content.location: Reimer's Ranch South Band   Shortcake Wall (aka "Oblivion Wall")   Start is to the right of Gut Punch the Buddha and on the beginning of Pinch the Buddha

content.description: Oblivion Wall is a short wall (aka Shortcake Wall) just to the left of Doctor Seuss and Prototype Walls.  It is home to five moderate routes (5.7 to 5.10a) with two to three bolts each and chain anchors.
